title: New police chief vows probe into protest deaths, offers apology
content: The newly appointed police chief of Bangladesh apologized for the actions of officers during recent deadly protests, promising an impartial investigation into the killings. He acknowledged unprofessional conduct by some officers and vowed disciplinary actions. The protests resulted in over 400 deaths, with many victims being young men with bullet wounds. A reshuffle in leadership aimed to restore order.
summary: The newly appointed police chief of Bangladesh apologized for the actions of officers during recent deadly protests, promising an impartial investigation into the killings. He acknowledged unprofessional conduct by some officers and vowed disciplinary actions. The protests resulted in over 400 deaths, with many victims being young men with bullet wounds. A reshuffle in leadership aimed to restore order.

title: Walz’s long history with China in focus
Democracy not possible without Awami League, says Hasina’s son
content: Sajeeb Wazed Joy, son of ousted PM Sheikh Hasina, emphasized that Bangladesh's democracy and elections are untenable without the Awami League, the nation's oldest party. In a video message, he called for eliminating militancy and violence and underscored the need for his mother’s family’s involvement, urging party members to stay strong amid current unrest.
summary: Sajeeb Wazed Joy, son of ousted PM Sheikh Hasina, emphasized that Bangladesh's democracy and elections are untenable without the Awami League, the nation's oldest party. In a video message, he called for eliminating militancy and violence and underscored the need for his mother’s family’s involvement, urging party members to stay strong amid current unrest.

title: Yunus acquitted in labour law case
Philippines' Carlos Yulo gets lifetime supply of ramen for winning Olympic gold
content: Carlos Yulo returned from the 2024 Paris Olympics with two gold medals and several rewards, including a three-bedroom condo and a lifetime supply of ramen. The 24-year-old gymnast made history by winning the men’s floor and vault events, adding two medals to the Philippines' tally. His achievements were recognized with significant perks and cash rewards.
summary: Carlos Yulo returned from the 2024 Paris Olympics with two gold medals and several rewards, including a three-bedroom condo and a lifetime supply of ramen. The 24-year-old gymnast made history by winning the men’s floor and vault events, adding two medals to the Philippines' tally. His achievements were recognized with significant perks and cash rewards.

title: Mohammed Yunus is set to be 32nd Nobel laureate to be a head of state
content: An interim government led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus was decided at a meeting in Bangabhaban with military leaders and student representatives. Former PM Sheikh Hasina resigned amid mass protests. Yunus, known for establishing Grameen Bank, aims to guide Bangladesh through its current crisis, despite past legal issues and his removal from the bank in 2011.
summary: An interim government led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus was decided at a meeting in Bangabhaban with military leaders and student representatives. Former PM Sheikh Hasina resigned amid mass protests. Yunus, known for establishing Grameen Bank, aims to guide Bangladesh through its current crisis, despite past legal issues and his removal from the bank in 2011.

title: What's behind strongest tremors felt in Southern California in years
content: A magnitude 5.2 earthquake struck Southern California on Tuesday night, with its epicentre near Mettler in Kern County. It was widely felt across the region, including Los Angeles. The initial shock was followed by strong aftershocks. No significant damage or injuries were reported. The quake was the strongest in the region in three years.
summary: A magnitude 5.2 earthquake struck Southern California on Tuesday night, with its epicentre near Mettler in Kern County. It was widely felt across the region, including Los Angeles. The initial shock was followed by strong aftershocks. No significant damage or injuries were reported. The quake was the strongest in the region in three years.

title: Biden says he is 'not confident' of peaceful power transfer if Trump loses presidential election
content: US President Joe Biden expressed doubts about a smooth transition to Vice President Kamala Harris if Donald Trump loses the November 5 election. In an interview, Biden said, "He means what he says. We don't take him seriously. He means it. All this stuff about if we lose there'd be a bloodbath," Biden added."
summary: US President Joe Biden expressed doubts about a smooth transition to Vice President Kamala Harris if Donald Trump loses the November 5 election. In an interview, Biden said, "He means what he says. We don't take him seriously. He means it. All this stuff about if we lose there'd be a bloodbath," Biden added."

title: Israel court hears bid to close prison where soldiers are accused of sexually assaulting Palestinian
Italy's newspaper depicts Kamala Harris as 'Red Indian', defends action
content: The newspaper cover adds to the identity confusion as Kamala Harris has been depicted with the Red Indian headgear. Editor-in-chief Tommaso Cerno explained the cover and said there was no confusion over Kamala Harris' origin. Kamala Harris was described with the headgear because 'redskins' are the symbol par excellence of all America's minorities who are "galvanized" by her candidacy.
summary: The newspaper cover adds to the identity confusion as Kamala Harris has been depicted with the Red Indian headgear. Editor-in-chief Tommaso Cerno explained the cover and said there was no confusion over Kamala Harris' origin. Kamala Harris was described with the headgear because 'redskins' are the symbol par excellence of all America's minorities who are "galvanized" by her candidacy.

title: Did JD Vance just check Kamala Harris' plane out? 'Going to be mine'. Watch
content: Both JD Vance and Kamala Harris landed at the same airport in Wisconsin on Wednesday around the same time. But then something 'weird' happened on the tarmac as JD Vance walked over to Air Force Two -- vice president Kamala Harris' plane. The reporters who were travelling with Kamala Harris-Tim Walz were surprised and JD Vance had a ready reply for them.
summary: Both JD Vance and Kamala Harris landed at the same airport in Wisconsin on Wednesday around the same time. But then something 'weird' happened on the tarmac as JD Vance walked over to Air Force Two -- vice president Kamala Harris' plane. The reporters who were travelling with Kamala Harris-Tim Walz were surprised and JD Vance had a ready reply for them.

title: ISIS terror plot at Taylor Swift concert in Vienna foiled, 2 arrested
content: Taylor Swift's upcoming concerts at Vienna were one of the targets of major ISIS plot which has been foiled with the arrest of two men by Austrian federal and state police. Taylor Swift's concerts will take place as scheduled, the police said. Swift is scheduled to perform at the Ernst-Happel-Stadion in Vienna on Thursday, Friday and Saturday for the international leg of The Eras Tour.
summary: Taylor Swift's upcoming concerts at Vienna were one of the targets of major ISIS plot which has been foiled with the arrest of two men by Austrian federal and state police. Taylor Swift's concerts will take place as scheduled, the police said. Swift is scheduled to perform at the Ernst-Happel-Stadion in Vienna on Thursday, Friday and Saturday for the international leg of The Eras Tour.

title: Karachi banker with Iran ties in foiled plot to kill Trump
content: Pakistan announced its communication with US authorities regarding a Pakistani national's alleged role in a failed plot to assassinate former President Donald Trump. The US Justice Department charged Asif Raza Merchant, who allegedly has connections with Tehran. Merchant purportedly sought to recruit individuals for the plot as retaliation for the killing of Iran’s Qasem Soleimani in 2020. He told investigators he has a wife and children in Iran and a separate family in Pakistan.
summary: Pakistan announced its communication with US authorities regarding a Pakistani national's alleged role in a failed plot to assassinate former President Donald Trump. The US Justice Department charged Asif Raza Merchant, who allegedly has connections with Tehran. Merchant purportedly sought to recruit individuals for the plot as retaliation for the killing of Iran’s Qasem Soleimani in 2020. He told investigators he has a wife and children in Iran and a separate family in Pakistan.

title: JD Vance says Tim Walz lied about military service: 'I went to Iraq but he...'
content: Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance accused Tim Walz of misleading the country about his veteran status and said he did not actually serve in the army and dropped out when he was asked to go to Iraq. The comment came as Walz made fun of JD Vance's Yale degree followed by his bestseller book attacking the elites.
summary: Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance accused Tim Walz of misleading the country about his veteran status and said he did not actually serve in the army and dropped out when he was asked to go to Iraq. The comment came as Walz made fun of JD Vance's Yale degree followed by his bestseller book attacking the elites.

title: German hotel collapse in Moselle wine valley kills two, one guest still trapped
BSF stops hundreds of Bangladeshis 'attempting to sneak into Indian territory'
content: The Border Security Force (BSF) on Wednesday prevented a group of over 120-140 Bangladeshi nationals from entering India at the North Bengal frontier. With the help of Border Guard Bangladesh, the group, including women and children, was dispersed. This occurred during violent protests in Bangladesh, forcing Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to resign and flee.
summary: The Border Security Force (BSF) on Wednesday prevented a group of over 120-140 Bangladeshi nationals from entering India at the North Bengal frontier. With the help of Border Guard Bangladesh, the group, including women and children, was dispersed. This occurred during violent protests in Bangladesh, forcing Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to resign and flee.

title: Serena Williams 'denied access' to Paris restaurant, staff explains incident, says ' she was ....'
content: Serena Williams criticized a luxury Paris hotel in a social media post after being denied entry to the hotel's rooftop restaurant due to full bookings. ​​Sharing a post on X Williams said: "Yikes @peninsulaparis I've been denied access to rooftop to eat in a empty restaurant of nicer places but never with my kids. Always a first."
summary: Serena Williams criticized a luxury Paris hotel in a social media post after being denied entry to the hotel's rooftop restaurant due to full bookings. ​​Sharing a post on X Williams said: "Yikes @peninsulaparis I've been denied access to rooftop to eat in a empty restaurant of nicer places but never with my kids. Always a first."

title: Kamala Harris interviewed three for VP pick but Tim Walz got it because...
content: A day after Kamala Harris chose Minnesota governor Tim Walz as her running mate in a surprising move sidestepping more popular Josh Shapiro, reports claimed that there was a particular reason why Tim Walz got the gig. His message to Harris was clear that he was not angling for anything else and that's what probably got him the opportunity, reports said.
summary: A day after Kamala Harris chose Minnesota governor Tim Walz as her running mate in a surprising move sidestepping more popular Josh Shapiro, reports claimed that there was a particular reason why Tim Walz got the gig. His message to Harris was clear that he was not angling for anything else and that's what probably got him the opportunity, reports said.

title: Democrats hope Tim Walz will open doors to more white votes for Kamala Harris
content: Kamala Harris selected Tim Walz as her vice-presidential pick. Despite facing criticism from MAGA Republicans, Walz brought a folksy charm and broad appeal, especially to white rural and suburban voters. At a Philadelphia rally, he defended his policies and aimed to swing critical voters in key states. His mid-western appeal contrasted sharply with the opposition's tactics.
summary: Kamala Harris selected Tim Walz as her vice-presidential pick. Despite facing criticism from MAGA Republicans, Walz brought a folksy charm and broad appeal, especially to white rural and suburban voters. At a Philadelphia rally, he defended his policies and aimed to swing critical voters in key states. His mid-western appeal contrasted sharply with the opposition's tactics.

title: Watch: Kamala Harris' viral expression when Tim Walz cracks couch joke on JD Vance
content: As team Kamala and Tim attended their first rally in Philadelphia, Kamala Harris' reaction to Tim Walz ripping into JD Vance went viral. In a now viral clip, Kamala can be seen looking at Tim in admiration and clapping as Tim said he can't wait to debate JD Vance, Trump's running mate -- provided JD is willing to "get off the couch and show up".
summary: As team Kamala and Tim attended their first rally in Philadelphia, Kamala Harris' reaction to Tim Walz ripping into JD Vance went viral. In a now viral clip, Kamala can be seen looking at Tim in admiration and clapping as Tim said he can't wait to debate JD Vance, Trump's running mate -- provided JD is willing to "get off the couch and show up".
